info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 8:03PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN BEAVER AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 803 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Cumberland, or near Weirton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raccoon Creek State Park and Hanover Township. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
